page.title: 20Fruit Vegetable Flower Fish
page.content: {Fruit and Vegetable Market-}From 1175 a weekly market was held in High St.In 1817 a market was made in Candleriggs. The market moved to Blochairn,near the M8,with more space.Owned by Glasgow District Council it was opened in 1969 by HM Queen Elizabeth.45 companies trade from 0700 Mon-Fri.Shopkeepers, caterers etc from all over the West of Scotland come to buy flowers,fruit and vegetables ranging from potatoes from Girvan to Kiwi fruit from New Zealand. {Fish Market-}The Market moved from the Bridgegate to near the Fruit Market in 1977.Fish from Aberdeen,Peterhead,Ayr, Oban and Ireland is sold by 22 firms. Trading starts at 0545 Tues-Sat.There being no fishing on Sundays market is closed on Mondays.Shopkeepers,caterers etc buy haddock,whiting,sole,salmon, trout,kippers,herring,lobsters,crabs, etc,most of which are sold by 1030.
